meanings.definition: To stop, bar, or prevent someone from asserting a claim or right.
meanings.sent1: The judge will estop the lawyer from making that argument in court.
meanings.sent2: The new law will estop any further attempts to claim ownership of the land.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally estopped my friend from telling his exciting story by interrupting him.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden laughter estopped the serious atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The loud alarm estopped the thief in his tracks, preventing the robbery.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone from denying the truth of a fact.
meanings.sent1: The evidence presented will estop any doubts about the suspect's guilt.
meanings.sent2: The witness's testimony will estop the defendant from claiming innocence.
meanings.sent3: The clear video footage estopped any chance of mistaken identity.
meanings.sent4: His confession estopped any further speculation about the crime.
meanings.sent5: The DNA results estopped all arguments against the scientific findings.
